meanings.definition: The action of completely surrounding or covering something.
meanings.sent1: The engulfment of the city by fog made it impossible to see beyond a few feet.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter witnessed the engulfment of the building by flames.
meanings.sent3: The engulfment of the sandwich by the hungry toddler was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The engulfment of the stage by the elaborate set design added to the magic of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The sudden engulfment of the room in darkness startled everyone inside.

meanings.definition: The state of being overwhelmed or consumed by something.
meanings.sent1: After the news of the accident, a feeling of engulfment washed over her.
meanings.sent2: The student felt engulfment as the deadline for the project approached.
meanings.sent3: The engulfment of emotions during the movie made her shed a tear.
meanings.sent4: The engulfment of responsibilities left him feeling drained and exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The engulfment of joy filled the room with laughter and smiles.
